data.text: You're all over the place with these tires. Your bike....the Posiedon Redwood is not fast...it's made for big chunky tires off road. Sure it can ride on the road..any bike can ride on the road but you should embrace what and where the bike is best suited. If you want a relatively fast(for a 29er) tire, go with something like a terreno XC 29x2.1 or something.
data.author: Josh Kebschull

data.text: You're swapping a tyre that has a specific cornering tread for one that doesn't. Cornering is where you're most likely to loose your grip. The Juniper Ridge don't like they're designed to excell at any one thing but if anything they more designed for loose/slightly sloppy not dry or sandy. When your tires went, how were you riding? Were you attacking, cornering, or accelerating? There's some stuff you just can't ride over without problems. I rode for a whole year on wtb horizons (almost no grip). Took them on every surface and condition apart from snow. It may not be advisable, but my riding improved and the few times I came off could've been avoided by more caution (or just any grip whatsoever ü§£)
